text: Selenite is an ion. Its chemical formula is SeO32-. It makes the hydrogen selenite ion, HSeO3- in neutral conditions. When in acidic conditions it makes selenous acid. They are normally made by heating metal oxides with selenium dioxide. An example would be sodium selenite. Selenites are weak at oxidizing. ==Related pages== *Selenate *Selenide Category:Selenium compounds Category:Oxyanions
title: Selenite (ion)
